    • Method Detail

      • createSaveGameDB

        private boolean createSaveGameDB(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method creates a saved games database for new users in the directory CSVfiles\ username where username is the player's created username
        Parameters:
        fileName - gives the location where the savedGames.txt database should be created
        Returns:
        a boolean true if the savedGames.txt database was created, false otherwise

      • saveGame

        public java.lang.String saveGame(GameBoard myBoard,
                                 java.lang.String saveGameName)
        This method saves the current game of the user under the directory CSVfiles\ username where username is the player's created username It saves it in the format of GameName_Date_Time where the Date_Time format is yyyy_MM_dd_HH_mm_ss
        Parameters:
        myBoard - is the current gameBoard of the user
        saveGameName - give the location where the savedGames.txt database should be created
        Returns:
        a boolean, true if the savedGames.txt database was created, false otherwise

      • addSavedGame

        public boolean addSavedGame(java.lang.String gameName,
                            java.lang.String dateTime)
        This method adds the user's saved game name in the savedGames.txt database in the directory CSVfiles\ username It saves it under two separate columns "Game Name","Date/Time"
        Parameters:
        gameName - is the user's inputted GameName
        dateTime - is the datestamp of when the Game was saved
        Returns:
        a boolean, true if the saved Game details were successfully appended to savedGames.txt, false otherwise

      • gameExists

        public java.lang.String gameExists(java.lang.String loadGameName)
        This method checks if a game name already exists in the case when a user wants to create a new saved game name or when a user wants to load a saved game. The savedGames.txt file is checked under the directory CSVfiles\ username
        Parameters:
        loadGameName - is the user's inputted GameName which is being checked for
        Returns:
        a String is returned if successful of the GameName appended with the date-time stamp, otherwise returns empty String

      • loadSavedGame

        public java.lang.String loadSavedGame(java.lang.String loadGameName)
        This method loads a saved game from the user's saved game list
        Parameters:
        loadGameName - is the user's inputted GameName which is being checked for
        Returns:
        a String of the file location of the Game to be loaded

      • loadSavedGamesList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> loadSavedGamesList(java.lang.String user)
        This method returns the list of saved games of a user saved under savedGames.txt
        Parameters:
        user - whose saved game list needs to be returned
        Returns:
        an Arraylist of Type String with all the saved game names. Only returns the Game Names and not the Date/Time stamp
